question: Question_05_(b)
statement:
Now define

\begin{align*}H(x,y) = \int_y^x \ln(2+\sin t)\,dt.\end{align*}

Find the first partial derivatives of \emph{H} and use this to compute
$\displaystyle \nabla H\left(\frac{\pi}2,\frac{\pi}2\right)$.
hints:
Recall the definition of the gradient:

\begin{align*}\nabla H(x,y) = \left\langle \frac{\partial H}{\partial x}(x,y), \frac{\partial H}{\partial y}(x,y) \right\rangle\end{align*}

To use
\href{Science:Math Exam Resources/Courses/MATH105/April 2012/Question 05 (a)}{part
(a)}, write \emph{H} in terms of \emph{F} and \emph{G}.
